result.execSummary:
The defendant Luis Alberto Najera-Diaz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

No firearms; weapons.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

No illegal substances.
No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agnet has approved a modification to no violent contact. Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.

Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
Complete a parenting class.
Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: This time is stayed pending a review on 10-24-14

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luis Alberto Najera-Diaz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Luis Alberto Najera-Diaz not in court.  Sarra M. Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Per email from Probation Dept., defendant is currently in absconder status.  Court ordered defendant to serve 90 days of the condition time; straight time.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.

AS TO THE AMENDED CHARGE:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
.
  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 11 days time served.  
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 3 MONTHS consecutive in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  
.
COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 45 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 10/24/14.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Complete a parenting class.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-No illegal substances.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Luis Alberto Najera-Diaz in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to COUNT 1:  Battery, Domestic Abuse, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), 968.075(1)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor  and COUNT 2:  Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), 968.075(1)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.
Response to Defense's Motion to Suppress Statements received and filed.  rmm
from the defense received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.   rmm
Sworn as interpreter:  Daniel Lopez.

Defendant Luis Alberto Najera-Diaz in court with attorney Christian T Eichenlaub.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 7/14/14 in Branch 40.  State withdrew their offer to the defendant.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.
to Suppress Statements received and filed.  rmm
State's Motion to Admit 911 Call received and filed.  rmm
from the state received and filed.  rmm
from the state received and filed.  rmm

BRANCH 23 FOR BRANCH 40
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Greenfield Police Officer Robert Austin. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40 for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.

Defendant Luis Alberto Najera-Diaz in court with Z. Fudge supervised by attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Michael C. Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Sworn as interpreter: Daniel Lopez.  Due to ADA assignment, case is re-assigned to branch 04, Judge Flanagan. Branch 23 to hear matter for Judge Flanagan.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Flanagan.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Dallet, Br. 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Christian T. Eichenlaub in court, defendant Luis Alberto Najera-Diaz not in court, in custody.  Matthew Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for preliminary hearing today.  The defendant is being detained by ICE.  Defense counsel advised the parties that the defendant has a detention hearing scheduled in approximately 30 days.  Based upon the defendant's custody status, Court orders time limits waived.  Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing in Branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Erendira M

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUTODY.
